com.googlecode.aluminumproject.expressions.el

Class FunctionDelegateFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.aluminumproject.expressions.el.FunctionDelegateFactory

  • public class FunctionDelegateFactory
extends Object
    Creates delegates that call functions. These delegates are needed since the EL function mapper expects functions to be static methods. In Aluminum, however, a function is an interface - it does not necessarily have to be implemented using a static method.

    There's one function delegate factory per JVM. The delegates are created using Javassist; for each configuration, a separate function class is created. These classes contain a method per function factory. When the method is invoked, the parameters are converted into function arguments and used to create a function. Finally, the function is called with the current context.

      • findDelegate

        public static Method findDelegate(Configuration configuration,
                  String libraryUrl,
                  String functionName,
                  Context context)
        Finds a delegate to a function.
        Parameters:
        configuration - the configuration to use
        libraryUrl - the URL of the library that contains the function
        functionName - the name of the function
        context - the context that the function will be invoked in
        Returns:
        a delegate to the requested function or null if the delegate can't be found

      • callFunction

        public static Object callFunction(String key,
                  Object[] parameters)
                           throws AluminumException
        Calls a function. This method is invoked by a delegate.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the delegate
        parameters - the parameters that were given to the delegate
        Returns:
        the function result
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when the function can't be created
